user.title: WillyWeather Setup - Station Selection
user.description:
Step 1 of 4: Enter your WillyWeather API key.

**Get your API key:**
Visit https://www.willyweather.com.au/api/register.html to register and obtain your free API key.

**Station ID:**
Leaving the Station ID blank will automatically set it to the closest WillyWeather station to your Home Assistant Home Zone location. You can also manually enter a specific station ID if preferred.

options.title: WillyWeather Setup - Sensor Configuration

data.include_observational: Include observational sensors (temperature, humidity, wind, pressure, etc.)
data.include_tides: Include tide information (Note: Not all areas have tidal information)
data.include_swell: Include swell data (coastal locations only, Note: Not all areas have swell information)

warnings.title: WillyWeather Setup - Optional Features
warnings.description:
Step 3 of 4: Configure optional features for {station_name}

**Weather Warnings:**
Warnings will alert you to dangerous weather conditions.

**Forecast Sensors:**
Forecast sensors create individual sensors for each day (0-6) with temperature, rain, UV data, etc. Perfect for custom cards!
- No additional API calls
- Compatible with custom Lovelace cards
- Easy automation triggers

data.include_forecast_sensors: Include daily forecast sensors (creates sensors for each forecast day)

update_intervals.title: WillyWeather Setup - Update Intervals
update_intervals.description:
Step 4 of 4: Configure update intervals for {station_name}

Separate intervals for observational (current conditions) and forecast data reduce API usage.

**Default setup:**
- Observational: 10/30 min (day/night)
- Forecast: 30/60 min (day/night)
- Total: ~7,920 API calls/month

data.night_start_hour: Night start hour (0-23, e.g., 21 for 9 PM)
data.night_end_hour: Night end hour (0-23, e.g., 7 for 7 AM)
